subject: 750a 4/21 Update: Soyuz braking rockets fired
body:
750a 4/21 Update: Soyuz braking rockets fired



=================================

CBS NEWS Coverage of Breaking Space News
Last Updated: 07:50 a.m., 04/21/07 (all times Eastern)

By William Harwood
CBS News Space Consultant

Changes and additions:

   04/20/07 (03:30 p.m.): Station crew prepares for Saturday landing
   04/21/07 (05:15 a.m.): Soyuz TMA-9 undocks from space station
   04/21/07 (07:50 a.m.): Soyuz braking rockets fired

=================================

07:50 a.m., 04/21/07, Update: Soyuz braking rockets fired

With cosmonaut Mikhail Tyurin at the controls, the Soyuz TMA-9's braking rockets fired at 7:42 a.m., slowing the ship enough to drop it into the atmosphere on a trajectory leading to a touchdown in Kazakhstan around 8:30:34 a.m. EDT. Tyurin and outgoing space station commander Mike Lopez-Alegria are wrapping up a 215-day mission, a single-flight record for a U.S. astronaut. Joining them for the ride home is U.S. businessman Charles Simonyi, who paid the Russians some $20 million to become the fifth tourist to visit the station. He blasted off with two new station crew members April 7 and is wrapping up a two-week voyage. This status report will be updated after landing or as conditions warrant.
